captions.text: On July 6 at 8:05 P.M., "Yuan Zai" was born!
It was a highly anticipated day for the zookeepers,
There was no time to celebrate
soon a lot of work began
It was everyone's first time watching "Yuan Yuan" give birth
"Yuan Zai's" birth went smoothly and she was held gingerly
The stressed zookeepers could now relax
Zookeepers, veterinarians
and two Chinese panda specialists
began the 24 hour watch of "Yuan Yuan's" caretaking
Later, they found out "Yuan Zai" had a wound
In order to prevent the underdeveloped immune system
from worsening the infection of the wound
the zookeepers began to feed "Yuan Zai" artificially
"Yuan Zai" is fed at a fixed time every day
and "Yuan Zai" is also given a rub down
The newborn panda cub can't poop herself,
so every day, there is also a fixed time to stimulate "Yuan Zai" to defecate
The zoo also invited panda cub specialists Wei Ming from China
to offer some assistance
He arrived at the scene later
and immediately started working
The schedule was so tight that he had no time to open his suitcases.
Zookeepers did not overlook "Yuan Yuan's" post-natal care
After delivery, the head chief of Giant Panda closely did a rub down
to help lighten "Yuan Yuan's" stress
The zoo invited China's panda breeding expert, Dong Li
to supervise and assist in post-natal care and breastfeeding techniques
In order to match "Yuan Yuan,"
the zookeeper sometimes came up with some interesting analogies for taking breastmilk.
The zookeeper treated the mother and daughter wordlessly with such care
and also customized "Yuan Zai's" quilt
When "Yuan Zai's" wound healed,
In order to let "Yuan Yuan" returned back to be at Mama's side
The zookeeper also diligently conducted many tests
Finally, the zookeeper's long-awaited day had arrived
where "Yuan Yuan" and "Yuan Zai" could reunite as mother and daughter
The zookeepers observing the reunion were very nervous
For fear of bothering the reunion, they took care to watch from the side
The Chinese expert was listening carefully
to see if "Yuan Zai" was making sounds as she drank the breast milk
The veterinarian checked the health conditions of both pandas after the reunion
The zookeepers thought "Yuan Yuan" was exhausted from taking care of "Yuan Zai," so they helped feed her
and gave her some water
The zookeepers kept an attentive 24 hour watch and record
So tiring, yet they don't dare rest
This is "Yuan Zai" now
Extraordinarily healthy
and strong
A very big applause to the zoo team who invested their time and energy
and also to "Yuan Zai's" friends who followed her growth
Thank you everyone!

most of the comments say "Yuanzai is so cute! Thank you, zoo keepers." and 
some of them suggest not to film the pandas 24hrs a day, they prefer the

worthy. and few people said Chinese government gave us the pandas is 
because they want to use cute pandas to curry favor with the public. so 
they can make it to dominate Taiwan. i'm just a pig, so if i said anything 
wrong, please don't mind. thx.

台灣人能研究貓熊研究多深我是不知道啦 不過中國既然有專業人士願意幫忙有什麼不好?? 說部長什麼的只是讓我們知道中國也很重視圓仔罷了 
這也沒什麼不好阿畢竟圓仔是我們的 指其說中國拿圓仔當統一的武器 你們倒是想想自己有100%愛用國貨? 
有100%對台灣的愛?100%參予台灣當前的問題? 如果沒有 就不要再講政治了 因為你們不配
